God Loves Ugly is the third full-length album by Minneapolis hip hop duo Atmosphere, released on June 11, 2002 on Rhymesayers Entertainment / Fat Beats Records.
Atmosphere\&#039;s slug is a poet of romantic dysfunction, a guy who mercilessly documents messy breakups. This Minneapolis indie-rap hero has star potential to spare, delivering taut, complex rhyme narratives with everyman earnestness. God Loves Ugly, Atmosphere\&#039;s fourth album, isn\&#039;t quite the therapy session that the last one, Lucy Ford: The Atmosphere EPs, was, but Slug still finds ample time to growl at an old flame (the scabrous \"Fuck You Lucy\") and warn a new one of the trouble she\&#039;s about to get herself into (the peppy, bemused \"Hair\"). Producer Ant knows enough to stay out of the rapper\&#039;s way, contributing the odd piano flourish and scratched-in sample. Like music\&#039;s best angry young men, Slug packs just as much self-hatred as bravado. \"I sleep next to women that I don\&#039;t deserve,\" he says on \"Saves the Day.\" \"They like to hurt my pride while I work they nerves.\" It\&#039;s as close to emo as hip-hop gets.
